comments.author: Kirsten
comments.content: Hey Michael - As a fellow buttermilk fan, making your own creme fraiche is dead simple. Just a tablespoon or two per cup of heavy cream, a clean jar and a day. See here: http://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=make+your+own+creme+fraiche&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8 Trust me. Once you do it, you won't buy it in the store again. (And you'll be adding it to everything!)

comments.author: Kirsten
comments.content: Oh and this sounds really good, BTW.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Indeed! We did it this way at a restaurant I worked at, and it was very delicious. I was a little hesitant to recommend it because I'm not sure if there are any food safety risks, but I would certainly encourage readers to research it and try it if they feel comfortable.
